title: Introducing the better way to always have the new iPhone: Verizon's new annual upgrade plan
text:
Submitted by admin on 9/24/2015 @ 3:49 PM   Verizon 
NEW YORK, Sept. 24, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- If you purchase either the iPhone 6s or iPhone 6s Plus with Verizon's Device Payment option beginning Friday, September 25, you'll be eligible to get a new iPhone every year. Yes, no more waiting for your contract to end. Now you can always have the latest iPhone - on the network that has the largest 4G LTE coverage in America. 
The new program allows you to turn in your phone and upgrade to a new iPhone every year. If you pre-ordered an iPhone 6s or iPhone 6s Plus, you're automatically enrolled in this program if you've elected the Device Payment option. 
If you're not interested in upgrading, you still have the option to pay your phone off in 24 low monthly payments. That's a better option than those "lease plans" offered by other companies, which can include surprise balloon payments just 18 months into your agreement, or ask you to turn over your phone without getting anything for it. 
Not with Verizon and thinking about joining America's largest and most reliable 4G LTE network? You can get up to $400 when you switch and trade in your old smartphone. Check out the details here: www.verizonwireless.com/iphone . 
Now you can always have the latest iPhone on the network that has the largest 4G LTE coverage in America. Because the best deserves the best. 
Beginning Friday, September 25, you can buy iPhone 6s and iPhone 6s Plus at Verizon retail stores and online at www.verizonwireless.com . For complete details on pricing, please visit www.verizonwireless.com/iphone . For more information on iPhone, please visit: www.apple.com/iphone . 
Verizon Communications Inc. (NYSE, Nasdaq: VZ), headquartered in New York, employs a diverse workforce of 178,500 and generated more than $127 billion in 2014 revenues. Verizon Wireless operates America's most reliable wireless network, with 109.5 million retail connections nationwide. Verizon also provides converged communications, information and entertainment services over America's most advanced fiber-optic network, and delivers integrated business solutions to customers worldwide.
